alert.note: Alert for Ballard (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 11:55AM EST until January 18 at 8:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam affecting Pulaski and Ballard Counties. Ohio River at Shawneetown affecting Union, Crittenden, Hardin and Gallatin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Kentucky...Missouri...Illinois... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam affecting Vanderburgh, Daviess, Warrick, Spencer and Henderson Counties. Ohio River at Cairo affecting Mississippi, Ballard, Pulaski, Hickman, Alexander, Fulton and Carlisle Counties. Ohio River at Mount Vernon affecting Union, Posey, Henderson and Vanderburgh Counties. Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam affecting Union and Posey Counties. .Recent heavy rainfall and snow melt will continue to keep water levels on the lower Ohio River in or near minor flood into next week. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Olmsted Lock and Dam. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Friday the stage was 38.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:00 AM CST Friday was 38.2 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 38.1 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 36.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Saturday afternoon at 100 PM CST.
